Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
March 6 & 7, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4146 Immunizations
• (1) A resident shall have current immunizations
as required by the department of community
health.
One of three youths did not have current immunizations.
2

CCI Rule 400.4152 Initial documentation
• (1) At the time of admission, all of the following
shall be in the resident’s case record:
• (c) A brief description of the resident’s
preparation for placement and general
physical and emotional state at the time of
admission.
One of three youth’s initial documention was missing a brief descripton of the
resident’s preparation for placement.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• I explained the meaning of a variance request, the process, the variance form and
how to complete it.
• Staff completing Vista Maria's discharge form should be reminded to fill out every
space on the form.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• I discussed possible reimplementation of behavior management rooms in
Freedom Center to provide a safe space free of external stimuli, reduce the need
for emergency restraints and decrease youth/staff injuries.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 5 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period. All 5 CAPs were monitored and verified as completed.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified in the annual audit reviewed.
3

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Management staff are monitoring CAP compliance on a monthly basis to assure
ongoing compliance is maintained.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff expressed concerns pertaining to the high level of violence and self-harmful
behaviors displayed by youth. They regularly share their concerns and ideas for
improvement with their supervisors.
Youth reported feeling safe and enjoy a myriad of recreational activities offered at
the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the kitchen, dining area, sleeping wing, general living space, staff offices
and calming rooms. The facility is clean and neat.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
